metadata.title: CVE-2018-5187 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 60 and Firefox ESR 60. Some of thesebugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enougheffort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60, Firefox ESR < 60.1, and Firefox <61.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
